title: Permanent Pet Champion?
body:
I'd very much like to see a champion with a permanent pet. Don't have a fully-fleshed out kit, but a ranger of sorts commanding a dog/wolf/lion/dragon/dinosaur would be great. The pet would function similar to Azir's soldiers, auto-attacking for the champion. If out of range of the pet, the autoattack would be carried out by the champion herself.

The abilities would be similar to Ori, moving and attacking with the pet (and possibly something for positioning).

It'd be cool if the ult would have buff the pet, growing immensely in size (similar to Mega Gnar) and maybe having the champion ride on it.

I just would like to see the role of a pet champ filled.

If this drummed up some interest, I'd consider filling out an entire champion concept.

Just kidding. These examples are not what I mean at all. I mean more along the lines of Orianna, with a living pet minion. These 3 have pets as part of their design, but not necessarily their gameplay. Nunu's kit could essentially just be Willump himself and he'd be exactly the same. Pix is not integral to Lulu's gameplay, just her character design. Same with Sejuani. Pix and Bristle could both be ditched for anything (Sej could ride in a go-kart for all that matters) and they'd still be the same.

Been thinking this over. My idea was having the pet be something respawnable (so not literally a living dog, but more like a spirit wolf or something). Maybe the passive would include a cooldown. Nothing too short/long, but just long enough that the pet is not killed at the beginning of a teamfight and then reappears to cleanup the same fight.

Also, if need be, the champion himself could have a different kit without the animal. Maybe his R spawns the pet? He would start with R like Jayce, Nid, etc, and toggling it would spawn/despawn the pet. His kit without the animal would have to be kind of weak though, perhaps offering escapes and stuff to get out of sticky situations?

I made a champion concept once about a Girl and her Poro companion. The Poro is like a dog and the concept is like a Hunter from WoW. The ultimate was Giant Poro Snax that made the Poro grow super large until it exploded.

**CYNTHIA AND ROOP**

(Basic character background, will update later)

Cynthia was born with magical inheritance but is very weak at conjuring any powerful form of spells. She met Poro after being nearly left for dead. They immediately bonded with eachother and decided to travel as a pair. 
Roop is a bigger than usual Poro who and acts very similiar to a loyal dog.
_____________________________________________
**Passive**

**Inheritance: **Cynthia's autoattacks deal (+% AP) bonus magic damage on-hit. 

**Spirit Bond: **Roop shares 20% of Cynthia's attack damage, ability power, magic resist and armor. 

If Roop is by Cynthia's side, Roop gains increased HP5.

If Roop dies he will be revived in 30 seconds (Scales with levels dropping to 10 seconds at max level) Visiting the shop will revive Roop instantly. 

**Q - CRUNCH!**
**Active:** Roop leaps to the target and bites them dealing (+% AP)- (+% AD) physical damage and apply on-hit effects. If there is no target, Roop can leap to the target location.

**Cynthia's Effect - ** Cynthia shoots a faint, dusty medium-range projectile in the targeted direction that does (+% AP) magic damage. This is a weak spell that puts Cynthia at risk of being attacked if in range and can be used if Roop is dead.

_This ability will go on cooldown, but Q can be used freely to make Roop simply auto-attack the target. If there is no target, Roop can move to the target location. This specific effect may be used if unranked or manaless and only serves to command Poro easier._

**W - LICK! **
**Active:** Roop makes it's tongue an intense blue and licks the target. They become frost-bitten. This spell can be used within the next 2 seconds to lick another target.

Frost-bitten: The player (enemy target) is overwhelmed and can't move for 2 seconds. The first target also takes (AP%) magic damage over 5 seconds.

**Cynthia's Effect -** Cynthia sprays in a faint, dusty short-range conic area that does (+% AP) magic damage and slows the targets hit. This is a weak spell that puts Cynthia at risk of being attacked if in range and can be used if Roop is dead.

**E - YELP! (TO MY SIDE)**
**Active:** Roop gains (+% AP) movement speed running back to Cynthia.

**Cynthia's Effect -**  If Poro is already by Cynthia's side, or dead, Cynthia will instead let out a burst of magic that does no damage but will knock-back all enemies around her, including Roop.

_This ability will go on cooldown, but E can be used freely to make Roop simply become passive by Cynthia's side. This specific effect may be used if unranked or manaless and only serves to command Roop easier._

**R - GIANT PORO-SNAX!**
Roop gains 100% of Cynthia's stats, instead of 20% and gains bonus armor and magic resistance. Roop also increases in size over-time until he finally explodes doing (+% AP) - (+% AD) physical damage. As Roop grows larger, the amount of armor and magic resist increases but his movement-speed depletes.  This effect lasts over 30 seconds.

It's an awesome idea, but like several ideas similar to this that I've seen, there are several problems that make it something of an unwieldy champion in LoL.
Problems that need to be dealt with are as such:
How can the pet be counter played?  Does it die and need to be re-summoned or at least be temporarly banished?  What can the champion do while the pet is down in this case?  Does the pet's stats mirror the champion's?  If so, how can the pet be balanced to prevent the champion from wandering around close by while the pet gets to auto attack?  Does the champion get to AA or does just the pet?  Can the pet AA at all?

However, in that respect, I think I've got an idea that I might hash out myself...
